intro: Lasiospora angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed lasiospora, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or along stream banks. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, dry fruits that disperse seeds via wind. Due to its delicate structure and specific habitat requirements, it is often found in temperate regions with cool, humid climates.
